trustfund:
TF038209-AFGHANISTAN: ECONOMIC WORK ON
            BUDGET ISSUES

abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome for the Programmatic Support
            for Institution Building for Afghanistan was satisfactory,
            the sustainability was likely, the institutional development
            impact was substantial, and the Bank and borrower
            performance were both satisfactory. Lessons learned from the
            project: Future operations will need to support further
            strengthening of budget processes to ensure timely budget
            implementation. The issue of weak capacity - notably to
            carry out the legal reform agenda - should inform the design
            of subsequent operations. Program ownership could be
            strengthened, notably to ensure continuity in reform
            implementation. The government could be encouraged to
            enhance consultations, within government and with key
            stakeholders, and communicate information about the reform
            process and progress towards these objectives. The
            monitoring framework requires further strengthening.
